1.name: Shichinin no samurai
1.description: A poor village under attack by bandits recruits seven unemployed samurai to help them defend themselves.

2.name: Rear Window
2.description: A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbors from his apartment window and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.

3.name: A Star Is Born
3.description: A film star helps a young singer and actress find fame, even as age and alcoholism send his own career on a downward spiral.

4.name: On the Waterfront
4.description: An ex-prize fighter turned longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses.

5.name: Sabrina
5.description: A playboy becomes interested in the daughter of his family's chauffeur, but it's his more serious brother who would be the better man for her.

6.name: Dial M for Murder
6.description: A tennis player frames his unfaithful wife for first-degree murder after she inadvertently hinders his plan to kill her.

7.name: Gojira
7.description: American nuclear weapons testing results in the creation of a seemingly unstoppable, dinosaur-like beast.

8.name: Creature from the Black Lagoon
8.description: A strange prehistoric beast lurks in the depths of the Amazonian jungle. A group of scientists try to capture the animal and bring it back to civilization for study.

9.name: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
9.description: In 1850 Oregon, when a backwoodsman brings a wife home to his farm, his six brothers decide that they want to get married too.

10.name: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
10.description: A ship sent to investigate a wave of mysterious sinkings encounters the advanced submarine, the Nautilus, commanded by Captain Nemo.

11.name: Animal Farm
11.description: A successful farmyard revolution by the resident animals vs. the farmer goes horribly wrong as the victors create a new tyranny among themselves.

12.name: The Far Country
12.description: A self-minded adventurer (Jeff Webster) locks horns with a crooked lawman (Mr. Gannon) while driving cattle to Dawson.

13.name: Them!
13.description: The earliest atomic tests in New Mexico cause common ants to mutate into giant man-eating monsters that threaten civilization.

14.name: La Strada
14.description: A care-free girl is sold to a traveling entertainer, consequently enduring physical and emotional pain along the way.

15.name: Vera Cruz
15.description: During the Mexican Rebellion of 1866, an unsavory group of American adventurers are hired by the forces of Emporer Maximilian to escort a countess to Vera Cruz.

16.name: Johnny Guitar
16.description: After helping a wounded gang member, a strong-willed female saloon owner is wrongly suspected of murder and bank robbery by a lynch mob.

17.name: White Christmas
17.description: A successful song-and-dance team become romantically involved with a sister act and team up to save the failing Vermont inn of their former commanding general.

18.name: The Caine Mutiny
18.description: When a U.S. Naval captain shows signs of mental instability that jeopardizes the ship, the first officer relieves him of command and faces court martial for mutiny.

19.name: The Long, Long Trailer
19.description: Nicky and Tacy are going to be married. Nicky wants to save up money for a house, but Tacy dreams of starting off with their own home on wheels--a trailer.

20.name: The Rainbow Jacket
20.description: A champion jockey is banned from racing so spends his time helping a young lad to become the next champion.

21.name: The Barefoot Contessa
21.description: At Maria Vargas' funeral, several people recall who she was and the impact she had on them. Harry Dawes was a not very successful writer/director when he and movie producer Kirk Edwards ...                See full summary »

22.name: River of No Return
22.description: The titular river unites a farmer recently released from prison, his young son, and an ambitious saloon singer. In order to survive, each must be purged of anger, and each must learn to understand and care for the others.

23.name: Hobson's Choice
23.description: Henry Hobson is a successful bootmaker, a widower and a tyrannical father of three daughters. The girls each want to leave their father by getting married, but Henry refuses because marriage traditions require him to pay out settlements.

24.name: The Egyptian
24.description: In ancient Egypt, a poor orphan becomes a genial physician and is eventually appointed at the Pharaoh's court where he witnesses palace intrigues and learns dangerous royal secrets.

25.name: Brigadoon
25.description: Two Americans on a hunting trip in Scotland become lost. They encounter a small village, not on the map, called Brigadoon, in which people harbor a mysterious secret, and behave as if they were still living two hundred years in the past.

26.name: The High and the Mighty
26.description: When a commercial airliner develops engine problems on a trans-Pacific flight and the pilot loses his nerve, it is up to the washed-up co-pilot Dan Roman to bring the plane in safely.

27.name: Sanshô dayû
27.description: In medieval Japan, a compassionate governor is sent into exile. His wife and children try to join him, but are separated, and the children grow up amid suffering and oppression.

28.name: Human Desire
28.description: A Korean War vet returns to his job as a railroad engineer and becomes involved in an affair with a co-worker's wife following a murder on a train where they meet.

29.name: Suddenly
29.description: In the city of Suddenly, three gangsters trap the Benson family in their own house, on the top of a hill nearby the railroad station, with the intention of killing the president of the USA.

30.name: The Country Girl
30.description: A director hires an alcoholic has-been and strikes up a stormy relationship with the actor's wife, who he believes is the cause of all the man's problems.

31.name: Destry
31.description: In his desire to control a frontier town, ruthless town boss Decker appoints the town drunk as sheriff who, in return, hires gunfighter Destry as his deputy.

32.name: Viaggio in Italia
32.description: An unhappily married couple attempts to find direction and insight while vacationing in Naples.

33.name: Carmen Jones
33.description: Contemporary version of the Bizet opera, with new lyrics and an African-American cast.

34.name: The Glenn Miller Story
34.description: Biography of bandleader Glenn Miller from his beginnings to his death over the English Channel in December 1944.

35.name: Demetrius and the Gladiators
35.description: In 1st century Rome, Christian slave Demetrius is sent to fight in the gladiatorial arena and Emperor Caligula seeks Jesus' robe for its supposedly magical powers.

36.name: The Last Time I Saw Paris
36.description: Charles returns to Paris to reminisce about the life he led in Paris after it was liberated. He worked on "Stars and Stripes" when he met Marion and Helen. He would marry and be happy ...                See full summary »

37.name: The Million Pound Note
37.description: As part of a bet, two aristocrats offer a penniless American a loan, without telling him that the amount is £1,000,000 in the form of a single banknote.

38.name: Shield for Murder
38.description: When a brutal police detective Lt. murders a bookmaker's runner for $25,000 in cash, a deaf mute sees him do it and now he finds he must kill again to cover his tracks.

39.name: Riot in Cell Block 11
39.description: Fed up with the inhumane prison living conditions, a general prison riot breaks out, leading to hostage-taking, a stand-off with the guards and eventual negotiations with the prison administration officials.

40.name: Young at Heart
40.description: The lives and romances of three sisters in a musical family; the youngest daughter's life is complicated by the subsequent arrival of a charming composer and a cynical music arranger.

41.name: Touchez pas au grisbi
41.description: An aging, world-weary gangster is double-crossed and forced out of retirement when his best friend is kidnapped and their stash of eight stolen gold bars demanded as ransom.

42.name: Garden of Evil
42.description: A trio of American adventurers marooned in rural Mexico are recruited by a beautiful woman to rescue her husband trapped in a cave in Apache territory.

43.name: Pushover
43.description: Undercover cop falls for the beautiful moll of a bank robber on the run and together they double-cross the hood and the cops.

44.name: Garden of Eden
44.description: War widow and pre-teen daughter leave home of tyrannical father-in-law in Florida, get lost on a detour, and find shelter at a nudist colony.

45.name: Senso
45.description: A troubled and neurotic Italian Countess betrays her entire country for a self-destructive love affair with an Austrian Lieutenant.

46.name: The Purple Plain
46.description: In WW2 Burma, a Canadian bomber pilot becomes reckless after losing his bride in a Luftwaffe air-raid.

47.name: There's No Business Like Show Business
47.description: Molly and Terry Donahue, plus their three children, are The Five Donahues. Son Tim meets hat-check girl Vicky and the family act begins to fall apart.

48.name: Golden Ivory
48.description: British settlers travel to Masai country in Kenya.

49.name: Black Widow
49.description: A young writer insinuates herself into the life of a Broadway producer.

50.name: Magnificent Obsession
50.description: A selfish playboy enamored by a woman he seems to hurt more than he intends begins to understand a deeper meaning to their relationship.
